name: New Scandinavian Cooking
overview:
New Scandinavian Cooking is a Scandinavian cooking show which, over the course of ten seasons, was hosted by Andreas Viestad, Tina Nordström and Claus Meyer, produced by the Norwegian production company Tellus Works in collaboration with American Public Television. A sequel series titled Perfect Day continued with the original hosts in rotation, with the cast addition of Sara La Fountain. It is also broadcast on channels such as AFC.

Beginning in 2003, the show debuted on PBS in the United States. It has also been broadcast in more than 130 other countries, including the United Kingdom, China, Germany, Italy and France, according to the show's producers a viewership of 100 million per episode. The first, second, fourth, fifth and sixth seasons were hosted by Norwegian food writer Andreas Viestad, the third season by Swedish chef and television personality Tina Nordström, and the fifth season was hosted by Danish chef and cookbook author Claus Meyer. The sixth season, a sequel series Perfect Day rotated the original hosts Viestad, Nordström and Meyer, with the addition of Finnish TV chef Sara La Fountain. The seventh season was once again named New Scandinavian Cooking, and still rotated between the Nordic hosts. During the eight and ninth seasons Andreas continued the series on his own, with his passionate storytelling, fusing history, nature and cooking – seeking out the origins of the food with his mobile kitchen. Iceland will be introduced in the upcoming season ten.

episodes.name: Mackerel – The Shiny Bounty of Summer
Many Flavors of Lamb
episodes.overview: A sheep gathering in southwestern Norway is observed. Also: beer-braised lamb shanks with sweet onions; pepper-fried lamb liver; lamb with rutabaga and mustard seeds; a Sunday roast.

episodes.name: Yesterday’s Food for the Future
episodes.overview: A visit to Rygge in southeastern Norway. Included: parsley-root cream with smoked salmon; fricassee of hen; roast goat.

episodes.name: The Holy Fish
episodes.overview: A visit to Norway's Helgeland coast, home to halibut. Featured dishes include smoked Greenland halibut with berries and potato salad; pickled halibut; baked halibut with cucumber and herbs; and pan-fried halibut with veal demi-glace.

episodes.name: Winning Game
episodes.overview: Venison dishes, including venison fillet with prune; venison liver with caramelized tangerine; a traditional hunter's stew with sour cream and goat cheese; and venison steaks.

episodes.name: Shellfish for Summer
episodes.overview: The Season 2 opener visits Blindleia in southern Norway, where host Andreas Viestad fishes for red shrimp and gathers mussels. Also: making classic and innovative shellfish sauces, and a Norwegian-style paella.

episodes.name: Old-fashioned Sweet Tooth
episodes.overview: The UNESCO World Heritage-listed town of Røros, Norway, is visited. Included: iced cake; raw-milk pudding; cheesecake with cloudberries.

episodes.name: Dry but Tasty
episodes.overview: Codfish, one of Norway's most important exports, is examined. Included: its route from near the Lofoten Islands in Northern Norway to the table in Italy.

episodes.name: All is well – if there is Herring
episodes.overview: Visiting Norway's west coast, home to herring fisheries. Also: making Scandinavian-style herring.

episodes.name: Shellfish Eldorado
episodes.overview: Fishing banks in mid-Norway are explored. Also: making dishes with scallops, crabs and lobster; and salmon and mussels.

episodes.name: Fat Ducks and Sweet Apples
episodes.overview: Visiting a duck farm and an old steamer on the Telemark canal, which unites coastal Norway with the mountain regions. Also: duck and trout recipes.

episodes.name: On Top of Norway
episodes.overview: A trek up Galdøpiggen, the tallest mountain in Norway. Also: dessert recipes that make use of summer fruits, including berries.

episodes.name: A Modest but Generous Spud
episodes.overview: Norway's southern inland region is visited. Also: cooking with potatoes; catching and preparing crayfish.

episodes.name: A World of Apples
episodes.overview: Visiting western Norway's Hardanger, which is known for its apples. Included: making an apple drink and a hot-apple dessert; baking traditional sourdough bread in a wood-fired oven.

episodes.name: Ice-cold Bounty
episodes.overview: Exploring Vesterålen in northern Norway. Included: preparing cod and Arctic char fresh from the North Sea.

episodes.name: Smoke and Water
episodes.overview: The Season 2 finale travels to Vestfold in southern Norway at the height of sardine season. Included: catching and smoking sardines.

episodes.name: Rich Farmland
episodes.overview: The Season 3 premiere visits the county of Hedmark in eastern Norway, which is known for its farms and produce. Recipes include beef meatballs; sour cream porridge with air-cured ham; and thick steaks served with mushroom ragu and potato gratin.

episodes.name: Popular Sausage
episodes.overview: In Norway, the culture and history behind a well-made sausage are explored. Included: potato pancakes; three types of sausages.

episodes.name: It All Starts with Kids
episodes.overview: A visit to a food culture center for children, Geitmyra Farm in Oslo. Recipes include a cereal breakfast; chicken soup; lamb stew; and a sweet dessert with pumpkin and yogurt.

episodes.name: Oil Adventure
episodes.overview: The fortress town of Fredrikstad in eastern Norway is visited. Recipes include emulsion sauces; preserved and deep-fried mackerel; crispy potatoes; and Norwegian coleslaw.

episodes.name: Captain Haddock
episodes.overview: A visit to the Stad peninsula in western Norway, where boats set sail to catch haddock. Recipes include haddock "envelopes" that are stuffed with carrots, saffron, cabbage and prosciutto; and a salad with smoked haddock.

episodes.name: Rain and Rainbows
episodes.overview: The Season 3 finale visits Bergen, a fishing hub that's known as Norway's wettest city. Recipes for trout and the city's famous fish soup are shared.

episodes.name: The Sweetest Cheese
episodes.overview: The Norwegian valley of Gudbrandsdalen, home to brown cheese, is visited. Included: combining brown cheese with roasted goat and a sweet caramel ice cream.

episodes.name: Mighty Volcanic Oven
episodes.overview: Icelandic hot spots are visited. Included: grilling inside volcano. Also: a lamb dish; salmon and vegetables; salt-baked, herb-infused trout.

episodes.name: The Grain Belt of the Country
episodes.overview: Nes in eastern Norway, the country's grain belt, is visited. Included: slow-cooked pig knuckle with malty, beer-flavored peas and spelt; a salad of sprouting grains and pan-fried zander fish; a malt shake; and an oven-baked pork roast with crackling.

episodes.name: The Smokehouse
episodes.overview: Western Norway smokehouses are toured. Included: dips for salted and smoked lamb; an appetizer of quick-cured lamb and trout with smoked apple; a traditional honey-glazed lamb served with a crisp cabbage salad and vanilla-infused rutabaga purée.

episodes.name: Milk and Chocolate of the North
A Taste of Winter
episodes.overview: Season 5 opens with a lunch made of grilled flatbread, cabbage salad and smoked salmon. Also: soup with meatballs; and a chocolate dessert.

episodes.name: Fish on a Platter
episodes.overview: Norway's Southern Trøndelag region and the islands of Hitra and Frøya are visited. Host Tina Nordström grills crab and lobster; dives for scallops; and grills salmon over an open fire.

episodes.name: Land of Fish and Apples
episodes.overview: Hardanger, a fjord valley known as Norway's orchard, is visited. Included: a Norwegian drink that's served with trout.

episodes.name: The Taste of Trees
episodes.overview: Hedmark in Eastern Norway, which is home to large farms and vast forests, is visited. Included: using smoke in cooking; making sweet apple-flavored pork chops with potato salad; preparing hot-smoked pork glazed with homemade birch syrup that's poured over waffles for dessert.

episodes.name: An Edible Park
episodes.overview: Frogner Park in Oslo is visited. Included: ice cream flavored with rose petals; Norwegian-style bruschetta with a wild-herb pesto; hamburger; and sausages.
